metro.Graphics

Class Draw

  • java.lang.Object
    • metro.Graphics.Draw

  • public class Draw
extends java.lang.Object
    Provides lots of methods to draw lines, rects, circles, ... onto the screen The Color is set for all following Draw-operations, so set the color and all following Draw-operations will use this color.
    Author:
    hauke

    • Method Detail

      • init

        private static void init()
        Initializes the screen for drawing on it. It also stops the spriteBatch for a transparent background.

      • reset

        private static void reset()
        Resets the screen and the spriteBatch to the default values so that METRO can use it normally. The drawing has finished at this point.

      • setColor

        public static void setColor(java.awt.Color color)
        Sets the current color. Everything after this will be drawn in this color.
        Parameters:
        color - Color to set.

      • Circle

        public static void Circle(int x,
          int y,
          int diameter)
        Draws a simple circle.
        Parameters:
        x - x-Position (upper left corner of circle)
        y - y-Position (upper left corner of circle)
        diameter - diameter=width=height of circle

      • Rect

        public static void Rect(int x,
        int y,
        int width,
        int height)
        Draws a rectangle onto the METRO.__spriteBatch.
        Parameters:
        x - x-coordinate (left upper corner)
        y - y-coordinate (left upper corner)
        width - Width of rectangle.
        height - Height of rectangle.

        Draws a rectangle on a specific sprite batch.
        Parameters:
        x - x-coordinate (left upper corner)
        y - y-coordinate (left upper corner)
        width - Width of rectangle.
        height - Height of rectangle.
        spriteBatch - The sprite batch to draw on.

        spriteBatch - The spriteBatch to use here.

      • Line

        public static void Line(int x1,
        int y1,
        int x2,
        int y2)
        Draws a line from one coordinate pair to another. This uses the METRO.__spriteBatch as default.
        Parameters:
        x1 - First x-coordinate.
        y1 - First y-coordinate.
        x2 - Second x-coordinate.
        y2 - Second y-coordinate.

      • Line

        public static void Line(double x1,
        double y1,
        double x2,
        double y2)
        Draws a line from one coordinate pair to another. This uses the METRO.__spriteBatch as default.
        Parameters:
        x1 - First x-coordinate.
        y1 - First y-coordinate.
        x2 - Second x-coordinate.
        y2 - Second y-coordinate.

      • Line

        public static void Line(int x1,
        int y1,
        int x2,
        int y2,
        com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.SpriteBatch spriteBatch)
        Draws a line from one coordinate pair to another onto the given sprite batch.
        Parameters:
        x1 - First x-coordinate.
        y1 - First y-coordinate.
        x2 - Second x-coordinate.
        y2 - Second y-coordinate.
        spriteBatch - The spriteBatch to draw on.

      • String

          int x,
          int y)
        Draws a string with the __stdFont (default font).
        Parameters:
        text - The text you want to draw.
        x - The x-coordinate.
        y - The y-coordinate.

      • String

          int x,

          com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.BitmapFont font)

        Parameters:

        x - x-coordinate
        y - y-coordinate
        font - The font of the text

      • String

        public static int String(java.lang.String text,
         int x,
         int y,
         int width)
        Draws a multi-line text with automatic line breaks.
        Parameters:
        text - The text to draw.
        x - The x-coord.
        y - The y-coord.
        width - The maximum width of the area where the text should be.
        Returns:
        Amount of lines/rows.

      • getStringSize

        public static java.awt.Dimension getStringSize(java.lang.String text)
        Calculates the size of a string when it's drawn onto the screen. This method usess the __stdFont (defualt font).
        Parameters:
        text - The text whose size you want.
        Returns:
        The size as a Dimension (width, height).

      • getStringSize

        public static java.awt.Dimension getStringSize(java.lang.String text,
                               com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.BitmapFont font)
        Calculates the size of a string when it's drawn onto the screen using the parameter "font".
        Parameters:
        text - The text whose size you want.
        font - The font that should be used to measure the size.
        Returns:
        The size as a Dimension (width, height).

      • getStringLines

        public static int getStringLines(java.lang.String text,
                 int width)
        Calculates the amount of lines needed to display the given string in the given space.
        Parameters:
        text - The string that should be displayed.
        width - The maximum width in pixel of the string.
        Returns:
        The amount of lines needed.

      • Image

        public static void Image(com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.TextureRegion image,
         int x,
         int y)
        Draws an image with its original size to the spriteBatch.
        Parameters:
        image - The TextureRegion (i call it "image" ;) ) that should be drawn.
        x - The x-coordinate (upper left corner)
        y - The y-coordinate (upper left corner)

      • Image

        public static void Image(com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.TextureRegion image,
         java.awt.Rectangle position)
        Draws an image to the sprite batch.
        Parameters:
        image - The TextureRegion (i call it "image" ;) ) that should be draw.
        position - The position as Rectangle of the image with x, y, width and height.

      • Image

        public static void Image(com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.TextureRegion image,
         java.awt.Rectangle position,
         java.awt.Rectangle areaOnImage)
        Draws an area of an image on the sprite batch.
        Parameters:
        image - The TextureRectangle (i call it "image" ;) ) from which an area should be drawn.
        position - The position of the image
        areaOnImage - The area on the image that should be drawn.
